channel.title: Machine Learning on Hugo Apéro
channel.description: Recent content in Machine Learning on Hugo Apéro

item.title: Corn Disease Detector
item.description: This project was built as a final group assignment during the Saturdays AI Quito 2021 artificial intelligence workshop. Background Infectious diseases are a major threat for many crops of high importance for the food security of many regions of the world. Each year, around 60% of farmers in Ecuador have reported pre-harvest losses due to infectious agents such as fungi and bacteria, in crops like banana, cacao, and potato.

item.title: Sentiment analysis of Ecuadorian political tweets from 2021 elections
item.description: This project was developed as a final group assignment during the Artificial Intelligence course at my bachelor, which I took as requirement for obtaining of my minor in Systems Engineering. Summary In this project, we captured sentiments of replies to tweets from two Ecuadorian presidential candidates in the 2021 elections (@LassoGuillermo and @ecuarauz). A model of neural networks was used to classify tweets considering their sentiment as positive, negative, or neutral.

item.title: The molecular basis of JAZ-MYC coupling, a key component of plant immunity
item.description: I worked on this project during my bachelor, collaborating as undergraduate researcher at the Computational and Theoretical Chemistry Group - Universidad San Francisco de Quito, in Ecuador. Summary The jasmonic acid (JA) signaling pathway is one of the primary mechanisms that allow plants to respond to a variety of biotic and abiotic stressors. Within this pathway, the JAZ repressor proteins and the basic helix-loop-helix (bHLH) transcription factor MYC3 play a critical role.
